title: Digital Rights Management (DRM)
description: DRM technologies govern the use, modification, and distribution of copyrighted works (such as software and multimedia content), as well as systems that enforce these policies within devices.
key-ideas: DRM will often require the collaboration of system tools or media applications to enforce DRM controls.
DRM protects the ownership of proprietary data and media.
DRM participating softwares may prevent sharing / forwarding of data.
Set a time to live, limiting time or number of accesses for data
Limit access based on IP, or physical location
